main event: Unidentified flying objects were observed over the Amarillo Air Force Base in Texas on August 3, 1953 by personnel at the control tower. The objects were described as disc-shaped and exhibited erratic movements at high speeds.
interesting points: The objects were observed at intervals for approximately 45 minutes by trained personnel, including military observers with over 2,000 hours of flying time.
One of the objects was observed to be reflecting the sun, giving off a momentary brilliant spark or flash, then darkening and appearing normal again.
The objects did not change in shape from an appearance of being cylindrical or cigar-shaped, and they did not appear to slow down or come to an abrupt stop.
The report suggests that the speed of the object was so great that they passed out of sight in a very short period of time.
The observation reports indicate similarities to other unidentified flying object sightings, and the high rate of speed at which the objects were traveling is highlighted as unusual.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects, described as disc-shaped
witnesses: Personnel at the control tower, including military observers
